thread.title: Alert: Do not apply a vinyl skin or wrap to your Nintendo Switch
thread.title_full: Alert: Do not apply a vinyl skin or wrap to your Nintendo Switch

title: Alert: Do not apply a vinyl skin or wrap to your Nintendo Switch
text:
Alert: Do not apply a vinyl skin or wrap to your Nintendo Switch It will apparently ruin it. By Robert Purchese Published 04/03/2017 
Do not apply a vinyl skin or wrap to your lovely new Nintendo Switch. The surface of the console and Joy-Cons reacts badly to the adhesive, causing the outer coating and logos to peel off. 
Dbrand, a prominent skin manufacturer, nobly brought the issue to light. It had been testing Switch consoles - one pre-release and 10 retail units - prior to skin production. 
"We're here to make a public service announcement that under no circumstances should you be buying a vinyl skin / wrap for your Nintendo Switch," wrote dbrand on the Switch subeddit , where it has understandably become something of a hero. 
"Both the Joy-Cons and the console are not compatible with vinyl wraps or any adhesive-backed skin of any kind." Yay! Phwoar. Looks a bit like a cake... Oh, hang on... Everything we know about Project Scorpio How powerful Microsoft's next system will be, backwards compatibility and more. Oh no. 
Dbrand added: "This is really quite unfortunate, not just because we were going to make a ton of money from this console, but moreso because it genuinely did look dope with a skin." 
Dbrand will refund anyone who pre-ordered a Switch skin with it. 
Jolly good show, dbrand. 
You can catch up with all of our Nintendo Switch launch coverage, including reviews and technical tests , all in one handy place. Sometimes we include links to online retail stores. If you click on one and make a purchase we may receive a small commission. For more information, go here . About Robert Purchese 
Bertie is a senior staff writer. He's part of the furniture here, a friendly chair, and reports on all kinds of things, the stranger the better. @Clert on Twitter.
